Summary: Oklo Inc., a fast fission clean power technology and nuclear fuel recycling company, began trading on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the ticker symbol "OKLO" on May 10, 2024, following the completion of its business combination with AltC Acquisition Corp. The company received approximately $306 million in gross transaction proceeds, which will be used to support its business plan and fund the initial deployment of its Aurora powerhouse. Oklo plans to provide clean, reliable, and affordable energy to customers across various markets, including artificial intelligence, data center, energy, defense, and industrial sectors. The company has appointed a new board of directors, led by Sam Altman as chairman, comprising industry leaders with experience in clean energy and technology.
Label: 5 stars

Summary: Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO) has a shareholder structure where individual investors hold the largest percentage of ownership, with 57% of the company. This implies that individual investors have significant control over the company and can influence management and governance-related decisions. The top 10 shareholders own 43% of the company, with 18% held by insiders, including the CEO and a member of the board of directors. Institutions own a small portion of the company, with only a few notable institutional investors holding shares. SuRo Capital Corp. is the largest shareholder, owning 11% of the company, followed by Jacob Dewitte and Caroline Cochrane, who own 9.2% and 8.9% respectively.

Industrial Tech, Robotics & Clean Tech 1x1 Conference. The conferences will take place in New York, Boston, and virtually between June 11 and August 20, 2024. Oklo representatives will be available for meetings at these events. The company is developing fast fission power plants to provide clean, reliable, and affordable energy at scale.

Summary: Oklo Inc., a company developing advanced fission technology and nuclear fuel recycling, will host an Investor Day on February 2, 2024, from 9:00 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. ET. The event will feature commentary from Oklo's senior leaders, including CEO Jacob DeWitte, COO Caroline Cochran, CFO Craig Bealmear, and Chairman Sam Altman, on the company's business model, technology, recent developments, and go-to-market strategy. The event will be streamed live from New York and available for replay on Oklo's website. Oklo is expected to complete its business combination with AltC Acquisition Corp. in early 2024, subject to stockholder approvals and closing conditions. The combined company will operate as Oklo and list on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker "OKLO".

Summary: Oklo Inc., a company specializing in fast fission clean power technology and nuclear fuel recycling, has filed a registration statement with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to register 62,440,080 unregistered shares of its common stock. The shares were previously detailed in a registration statement filed in September 2023 in connection with the company's initial business combination. The registration statement does not create freely tradable shares, as all shares are subject to either contractual lock-up restrictions or performance vesting requirements. Specifically, shares held by Oklo management and AltC Acquisition Sponsor LLC are subject to long-term lock-up restrictions that expire in tranches over a three-year period. The registration statement has not yet become effective and is subject to change.

Summary: Oklo Inc., a company developing fast fission clean power technology and nuclear fuel recycling, has completed the second phase of the Thermal Hydraulic Experimental Test Article (THETA) testing campaign in collaboration with Argonne National Laboratory. The THETA testing campaign aims to improve the understanding of thermal-hydraulic behavior in Oklo's fast fission reactor design, enabling design optimizations and providing high-fidelity data. The testing was conducted at Argonne's Mechanisms Engineer Test Loop facility, with Oklo sharing costs for the work done at Argonne National Laboratory with funding from a Department of Energy Gateway for Accelerated Innovation in Nuclear voucher. The successful completion of the second phase of testing enables Oklo to further improve the demonstrated safety and economic potential of bringing its fast fission technology to market.
Label: 4 stars

Summary: Apple's stock price surged 7% on Tuesday, reaching a record-high close, following the announcement of its AI platform, Apple Intelligence. The company's shares fell slightly in pre-market trading on Wednesday, down less than 1%. The stock had previously fallen on Monday during and after the company's WWDC conference, but rebounded with some analysts praising the company's announcements. Apple Intelligence is a new AI platform that will be integrated across the company's hardware and software products, including the iPhone, Mac, and iPads. The platform will be available later this fall for iPhone 15 Pro and iPads and Macs running Apple's M1 series chips and newer. Key features of the launch include updates to Siri, which will be able to perform tasks such as parsing phone messages for addresses and finding photos in a phone's photo library based on voice prompts. The company also launched new software updates for its iPhone, watches, and computer products. Some analysts believe that the release of AI features across devices will support an upgrade cycle across all devices, driving the hardware upgrade cycle.

Summary: The article discusses the growing demand for AI-enabled PCs, driven by the need to reduce costs associated with processing generative AI workloads. According to Microsoft's estimates, the cost of using GPT-4, a large language model, is $0.03 per 1,000 tokens for prompts and $0.06 for completion. As millions of users access these models from their devices, the costs of scaling these systems become unsustainable. As a result, the market is shifting towards allowing users to process AI-intensive workloads natively on their devices, rather than relying on cloud-based solutions. Canalys predicts that AI PC shipments will increase to 170 million in 2027, representing a 60% share of the total PC market. The firm also expects AI PC shipments to double from 2023 to 2024 and double again from 2024 to 2025. Additionally, Canalys predicts that vendors will ship 205 million AI-capable PCs in 2028, representing a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 44% from 2024 to 2028. The article also mentions that Insider Monkey's database of 919 hedge funds has identified 8 AI PC stocks with the highest number of hedge fund investors, which may be of interest to investors seeking to imitate the top stock picks of successful hedge funds.
Label: 1 star

Summary: Apple has announced that it is discontinuing its "Apple Pay Later" service, which allowed customers to split purchases into four payments with no interest or fees. The service will no longer be available in the US, but existing loans will not be affected. Apple is instead integrating third-party services, such as Affirm Holdings and Citigroup, into its upcoming iOS 18 software, allowing users to access instalment loans from various lenders. Meanwhile, Palantir Technologies, a software company, has been given a "Buy" rating by Argus Research analysts, who believe the company will benefit from growing sales to commercial clients. The analysts have set a target price of $29 for the stock.

Summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is one of the hardware stocks that has been impacted by the growing importance of artificial intelligence (AI) in the stock market. According to a recent list of the 15 Best Hardware Stocks According to Hedge Funds, Apple's performance will be compared to other hardware stocks. The first half of 2024 has seen AI play a dominant role, with stocks that design semiconductors for AI applications or use them to streamline operations or offer products to customers experiencing significant gains. This optimism for accelerated computing technologies has led to some top AI companies posting triple-digit percentage share price returns over the past year. Some of these top-performing AI stocks have appreciated by 213% over the past 12 months and 773% since November 2022. The market has shifted from investing in AI companies that can change the world to evaluating their ability to deliver. The first quarter of 2024's earnings season saw Wall Street take a tough approach to firms that struggled to grow revenues or control costs, particularly those targeting AI.

Summary: The Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK), a $71 billion ETF managed by State Street Global Advisors, is expected to undergo a rebalancing in June, which would increase its exposure to Nvidia Corp. and decrease its exposure to Apple Inc. Nvidia's market value surpassed Apple's on Friday, triggering the rebalancing. The ETF has been holding fewer Nvidia shares than its S&P 500 Information Technology Index counterpart, resulting in underperformance this year. As a result, Apple's weight in the ETF is expected to drop to 4.5%, while Nvidia's weight is expected to rise above 20%. This rebalancing is expected to involve the purchase of $11 billion in Nvidia shares and the sale of $12 billion in Apple shares, which could generate significant trading volume.

Summary: Mar Vista Investment Partners, LLC released its "Mar Vista Focus strategy" first quarter 2024 investor letter, which reported a net-of-fees return of +5.53%. The S&P 500 index had a strong first quarter, driven by enthusiasm for AI, robust corporate earnings, and anticipation of rate cuts. The strategy's top 5 stocks, including Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL), were highlighted in the letter. Apple Inc. is an American multinational company that designs, manufactures, and markets various products. The company's stock was pressured in the quarter due to concerns over softening demand for smartphones, regulatory action, and Chinese government restrictions. Despite these challenges, Mar Vista Focus strategy believes Apple remains competitively advantaged and benefits from its ecosystem, which has an installed base of over 2 billion devices and over 1 billion paying subscribers. The strategy expects the ecosystem to support a predictable cash flow stream, which should grow intrinsic value high-single-digits over the investment horizon.

Summary: Nvidia, Microsoft, and Apple have been vying for the title of world's most valuable company, driven by investor enthusiasm for artificial intelligence (AI). The three companies, all with market capitalizations over $3 trillion, are within the Technology Select Sector SPDR exchange-traded fund (ETF), which is set to rebalance its portfolio on Friday. The rebalancing will result in Nvidia surpassing Apple as the second-largest holding in the ETF. Nvidia's shares have surged nearly 160% this year, driven by its dominance in the AI chip market and record revenue of $26 billion in the last quarter. The company has also completed a 10-for-1 stock split and increased its quarterly dividend payout. Analysts are predicting further growth, with one predicting Nvidia's shares could reach $200 this year.

Summary: Apple's stock (NASDAQ:AAPL) reached new 52-week highs after the company's Worldwide Developers Conference, where it showcased new features and announced its own AI platform, Apple Intelligence. The platform is designed to revolutionize the user experience and potentially trigger a new era of innovation. Apple Intelligence is integrated into iPhones, allowing for personalized technology by leveraging user data. This could be a solution to the prolonged stagnation in device sales, particularly for the iPhone, which has seen relatively flat unit sales over the years due to the increasing durability of Apple's products and lack of compelling reasons for upgrades. The introduction of Apple Intelligence may potentially trigger an all-around trend of upgrades, potentially ushering in an iPhone sales supercycle.

Summary: The US stock market is experiencing a quiet close to the week, with the S&P 500 index down 0.1% in early trading. The Dow Jones Industrial Average is down 6 points, or less than 0.1%, and the Nasdaq composite is virtually flat. Nvidia's stock is continuing to decline, down 2.7%, after surging over 1,000% since October 2022. The company's stock has briefly surpassed Microsoft as the most valuable on Wall Street, but its recent drops put it on track for its first losing week in nine. Summary: Nvidia's stock price experienced a significant fluctuation this week, reversing direction from all-time highs. Despite this, Bank of America reiterated its Buy rating and $150 price target, citing the company's dominance in the market. Nvidia's market capitalization briefly surpassed Microsoft's, but has since fallen to around $3.12 trillion. Analyst Patrick Moorhead warned investors to be cautious of signs of a pullback, citing the importance of downstream profitability and increased competition from other companies. He noted that if software companies such as Adobe and Salesforce do not generate more revenue from AI features, Nvidia's growth may slow. The company's recent earnings report showed significant growth, with adjusted earnings surging 461% year-over-year and revenue growing 262%. Nvidia also completed a 10-for-1 stock split and doubled its quarterly cash dividend. The company's stock has increased by 200% over the last 12 months and 3,200% over the last five years.

Summary: According to a Bloomberg article, the expiration of options contracts, known as "triple witching," is expected to drive significant trading volume and volatility in the markets. Approximately $5.5 trillion in derivatives contracts tied to equities, index options, and futures are set to expire on Friday, with Nvidia Corp. being one of the most heavily affected assets. The value of contracts tied to Nvidia is the second-largest of any underlying asset, after the benchmark S&P 500 gauge. As the contracts expire, investors will adjust their positions, leading to a surge in trading volume and potentially causing individual holdings to swing. The S&P 500's trading volume is already 60% above its average for the past month. The options event comes at a critical time for markets, as investors position for the second half of 2024 and the Federal Reserve's next steps. Data shows that US services activity picked up in early June to its fastest pace in over two years, while existing home sales fell for a third consecutive month.
Label: 2 stars
